titles.title: To designate the Federal building located at 600 Princess Anne Street in Fredericksburg, Virginia as the "Samuel E. Perry Postal Building".

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1203-1204)
Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Miss Collins (MI) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Burton objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as Agreed to by recorded vote (2/3 required): 423 - 2 (Roll no. 441).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: 10/7/94 CR S14801)

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 9/21/1993--Passed House amended. Designates the Post Office building located at 600 Princess Anne Street, Fredericksburg, Virginia, as the Samuel E. Perry Post Office Building.
